intro: Alloschemone inopinata, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has hairy leaves and produces capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Alloschemone inopinata plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
